Class Menu

java.lang.Object
Menu
public class Menu extends Object
The Menu class handles the user interactions in the game, including displaying various menus, reading input from the player, and printing various messages or visuals. It uses a Scanner for reading user input and contains methods to interact with the player at different stages of the game.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Menu()
    Constructs a new Menu and initializes the Scanner for user input.

  • Constructor Details

    • Menu

      public Menu()
      Constructs a new Menu and initializes the Scanner for user input.

  • Method Details

    • choseMenu

      public String choseMenu()
      Displays the main menu to the user and allows them to choose between creating a character or quitting the game.
      Returns:
      A String representing the user's menu choice.

    • printDragon

      public void printDragon()
      Prints a dragon ASCII art to the console as part of the menu display.

    • choseClassType

      public String choseClassType()
      Prompts the user to choose a character class between mage and warrior.
      Returns:
      A String representing the chosen class.

    • choseName

      public String choseName()
      Prompts the user to enter a name for their character.
      Returns:
      A String representing the name chosen by the user.

    • mainMenu

      public String mainMenu()
      Displays the main game menu with options for viewing statistics, modifying the character, starting the game, or quitting the game.
      Returns:
      A String representing the user's menu choice.

    • printInvalidClass

      public void printInvalidClass()
      Prints an error message indicating that the user has selected an invalid character class. This method should be called when the user tries to choose a class that does not exist.

    • printPersonnage

      public void printPersonnage(personnages.Personnage personnage)
      Displays the details of the given Personnage by calling its toString method.
      Parameters:
      personnage - The character whose details are to be printed.

    • printDices

      public void printDices()
      Displays a visual representation of the dice and prompts the user to roll the dice to begin the game.

    • printSingleDice

      public void printSingleDice(int choice)
      Displays a visual representation of a single die based on the user's choice.
      Parameters:
      choice - An int representing the face of the die (1-6).

    • diceMenu

      public String diceMenu()
      Displays a menu for rolling dice, viewing character statistics, or quitting the game.
      Returns:
      A String representing the user's menu choice.

    • winMenu

      public String winMenu()
      Displays a win message to the user and presents the option to restart the game or quit.
      Returns:
      A String representing the user's choice to restart or quit.

    • loseMenu

      public String loseMenu(String tileString)
      Displays a lose message to the user and presents the option to restart the game or quit.
      Parameters:
      tileString - name of the monster that killed the player
      Returns:
      A String representing the user's choice to restart or quit.

    • printLose

      public void printLose()
      Displays to the player a lose sentence.

    • printTileEvent

      public void printTileEvent(cases.Case tableau)
      Prints the event associated with a given tile depending on the player position on the board.
      Parameters:
      tableau - the Case object representing the current tile to display.

    • showPlayerTile

      public void showPlayerTile(int tileNumber)
      Displays the result of a dice throw in a formatted message. This method can be called after a player rolls the dice.
      Parameters:
      tileNumber - tile on which the player is stationed

    • showDiceThrow

      public void showDiceThrow()
      Show result of the random (1-6) dice throw.

    • clearScreen

      public void clearScreen()
      Clears the console screen. This method uses ANSI escape codes to clear the terminal screen.
